title: Can this man finally make golf cool?
text:
Gone are the days of argyle tank tops, beige slacks and warm G&Ts on the 19th hole. As a new generation of golfers bring boyband glamour (and even humour) to the fairways, Californian entrepreneur Stephen Malbon is upping the fashion ante and getting everyone from rappers to influencers and movie stars into the swing of the game.

Time was that on seeing a young person with a set of golf clubs, some people might stare and snigger: ‘Why is that kid bothering to play an old man’s sport?’ Golf was entrenched in a grim image of clubhouses filled with boring old fogeys in blazers swigging gin and guffawing at in-jokes, usually at the expense of women.
